required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Benefits of Pulmonary Rehabilitation in Patients With Severe Lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM)
clinical_study.official_title: Benefits of Pulmonary Rehabilitation in Patients With Severe Lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM) - a Retrospective Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: Data from patients with the orphan disease of lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM) which performed a pulmonary Rehabilitation program will be analyzed retrospectively. Data will be taken from the internal data base of the reference Center (Schoen Klinik Berchtesgadener Land, Schoenau, Germany) where These data were collected during clinical routine. Data will be included from the year 2000 until now. A retrospectively matched COPD cohort will be included for comparison.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline 6 Minute walk distance at week 4
primary_outcome.description: the walked distance in meter will be the Primary outcome of the 6 Minute walk test

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Quality of life at week 4
primary_outcome.description: the physical and mental health component summary score from the Short Form 36 Health Questionnaire will be recorded. Score range from 0 to 100 with lower scores indicating worse impairment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline lung function at week 4
secondary_outcome.description: forced expiratory volume in 1 second and inspiratory vital capacity will be provided in Liter and percent predicted

intervention.description: Patients will perform a comprehensive, inpatient pulmonary rehabilitation program for 4 weeks duration

study_pop.textblock: patients with a confirmed diagnosis of Lymphangioleiomyomatosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- confirmed diagnosis of Lymphangioleiomyomatosis
- performed a pulmonary Rehabilitation program at the reference center
Exclusion Criteria:
- missing data
- repeated stay for pulmonary Rehabilitation at the reference center
